intro: Atelanthera contorta, commonly known as the spiral leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves along its stems. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often narrow and have a slightly serrated edge, while its stems are erect and branching. Atelanthera contorta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage.
